item.title: Secondary DNS cannot transfer zone
item.description: I’m no Bind expert but I’m not a beginner either. I was configuring a secondary backup DNS for a master server and I noticed that after configuring everything the zones didn’t get replicated on the slave DNS. I checked the logs and saw the following: First I thought there was a mistake related to a missing permission on the master configuration allow-transfer { aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd; }; I double checked but the permissions were set correctly.

item.title: DNS::ZoneParse has an undocumented $ORIGIN
item.description: I was working writing a few scripts that should update a DNS zone file on the fly. I decided to use the DNS::ZoneParse perl module for convenience. The example there is straightforward for changing MX records so I thought modifying it to change an A record should be a piece of cake. Right? Wrong! For the love of it I couldn’t get my code to modify the record in question, it would always delete it.
